benchmark_details.name: CURIE (Scientific Long-Context Understanding, Reasoning and Information Extraction)
benchmark_details.overview: CURIE is a benchmark designed to measure the potential of Large Language Models (LLMs) in scientific problem-solving through ten challenging tasks across six disciplines, featuring 580 problems and solution pairs curated by experts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs on scientific reasoning and understanding long-context information across diverse scientific fields.

data.source: Curated from scientific literature across six disciplines with annotations by domain experts.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts in scientific domains.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the comparison of model outputs to curated ground truth by experts.
methodology.interpretation: Scores are normalized to [0, 1] representing performance from poor to good.
methodology.validation: Evaluation frameworks established through expert collaboration and iterative testing.
